Posts

  • Apr 11, 2018 The Scirate Python Package I wrote a Python package that extracts information from the website Scirate; a website that aggregates arXiv postings. In this post, we take a cursory glance at what one can do using this Python package.
  • Jan 10, 2018 Natural Language Processing in Python: Part 5 -- Stemming and Lemmatization Write-up for Part 5 of YouTube NLP in Python series. We consider what functionality NLTK provides to us for stemming and lemmatizing words.
  • Jan 9, 2018 Natural Language Processing in Python: Part 4 -- WordNet Write-up for Part 4 of YouTube NLP in Python series. We use NLTK to explore WordNet, a lexical database of the English language.
  • Jan 8, 2018 Natural Language Processing in Python: Part 3 -- Generating Word Clouds Write-up for Part 3 of YouTube NLP in Python series. This tutorial is focused on how to make use of the wordcloud module along with matplotlib and nltk to generate word clouds from various content sources.
  • Jan 7, 2018 Natural Language Processing in Python: Part 2 -- Accessing Text Resources Write-up for Part 2 of YouTube NLP in Python series. We continue our exploration of NLTK and begin to dive into the text resources that NLTK provides.
  • Jan 3, 2018 Natural Language Processing in Python: Part 1 -- Introduction Write-up for Part 1 of YouTube NLP in Python series. We provide instructions for installing the natural language toolkit (NLTK) in Python. We then use this to explore rudimentary natural language processing on the text "Alice in Wonderland"
  • Dec 27, 2017 60 Books Read in 2017 A listing and one sentence summary of the books I read in 2017.
  • Sep 30, 2017 Bloom Filters and Pokemon We take a look at the Bloom filter data structure with some help from Pokemon.
  • Sep 13, 2017 Music Page Now Added to Website Brief description of new music page and recent activity on YouTube channel.
  • Jul 19, 2017 New Android App: Lights Out Game A quick post to describe my recent Android application release of Lights Out.
  • Jun 14, 2017 New Android App: Ukulele Trainer A quick post to describe my recent Android application release of " Ukulele Trainer".
  • May 31, 2017 An Brief Overview of my Thesis A readers digest version of my thesis.
  • Apr 14, 2017 Using TensorFlow on Categorical Data We use TensorFlow to attempt to determine the edibility of a mushroom based on its physical traits that are encoded categorically.
  • Mar 24, 2017 Data Driven South Park We perform data analysis and some basic natural language processing on 70,000 lines of South Park dialog. We then train a recurrent neural network on the South Park dialog.
  • Mar 18, 2017 The Most Metal Guitar Tuning We investigate the age-old question What is the most metal guitar tuning.
  • Feb 28, 2017 The Mathematics of Lights Out Lights Out is a puzzle game that was originally produced by Tiger Electronics in 1995, and we take a look at the math behind it.
  • Jan 19, 2017 100 Books Read in 2016 A listing and one sentence summary of the books I read in 2016.
  • Oct 19, 2016 An Android App for Distinguishing Clouds from Contrails Using Machine Learning Adventures in training an image classifier to determine clouds from contrails.
  • Oct 8, 2016 Twitter Sentiment Analysis for the First 2016 Presidential Debate After the first presidential debate between Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump, what is the mood on Twitter?
  • Aug 18, 2016 A Neural Network in TensorFlow for Classifying Cancer Data Using UCI breast cancer data, we build a simple neural network classifier in TensorFlow to determine is a tumor is benign or malignant.
  • May 18, 2016 Data Analysis in R of the 2016 Michigan Primary Election On March 8th, 2016, Michigan (my home state) held the presidential primary for the 2016 presidential election. We take a dive into the data.
